page.title: 03Lanner (History)
page.content: Lanner is a village about 1\ miles east of Redruth with a population of about 2000. It is in the old mining area and there are many relics of the past including derelict engine houses, spoil tips, the old 'tram'(the track of one of the old mine railways) and the old drainage ditches and tunnels.It is now an agricultural area but many people commute into Redruth, Truro or Falmouth for work. Lanner has two churches includind a Wesleyan Methodist chapel dating from the time when John Wesley was touring and preaching in Cornwall.
